section.title: How to write tests for Naked Objects application code
section.para: If you are using the NOF purely for the first type of prototyping (i.e. to create a ‘sketch’ or ‘prototype’) then testing will play little role. For the other two types of prototyping, then, assuming that you are following a ‘test-driven’ or other ‘agile’ methodology, you should be looking to build testing in from the earliest stages of the project - so that by the time you have completed the prototyping you have executable tests to cover all aspects of functionality. The NOF provides excellent support for test-driven development in the form of its XAT (eXecutable Acceptance Test) framework. This section shows you how to write such tests.
